title: Building Floorspace in China: A Dataset and Learning Pipeline. (arXiv:2303.02230v2 [cs.CV] UPDATED)
abstract: This paper provides a first milestone in measuring the floorspace of buildings (that is, building footprint and height) for 40 major Chinese cities. The intent is to maximize city coverage and, eventually provide longitudinal data. Doing so requires building on imagery that is of a medium-fine-grained granularity, as larger cross sections of cities and longer time series for them are only available in such format. We use a multi-task object segmenter approach to learn the building footprint and height in the same framework in parallel: (1) we determine the surface area is covered by any buildings (the square footage of occupied land); (2) we determine floorspace from multi-image representations of buildings from various angles to determine the height of buildings. We use Sentinel-1 and -2 satellite images as our main data source. The benefits of these data are their large cross-sectional and longitudinal scope plus their unrestricted accessibility. translated_title: 中国楼宇建筑面积数据集与学习流程的构建
translated_abstract: 本文提供了中国40个主要城市楼宇建筑面积（建筑物占地面积和高度）测量的第一个里程碑。我们利用多任务对象分割器方法在同一框架中学习建筑物占地面积和高度，利用Sentinel-1和-2卫星图像作为主要数据源。本文提供了详细的数据集构建和学习流程说明。
tldr: 本文构建了中国40个主要城市楼宇建筑面积数据集并利用多任务对象分割器方法学习了建筑物占地面积和高度，为城市规划提供数据支持。
en_tdlr: This paper builds a dataset of building floorspace for 40 major Chinese cities and uses a multi-task object segmenter approach to learn building footprint and height, providing data support for urban planning.
